articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China cut its one-year benchmark lending rate on Monday as authorities seek to ramp up efforts to stimulate credit demand, but surprised markets by keeping the five-year rate unchanged amid broader concerns about a rapidly weakening currency.
articles.title: China surprises with modest rate cut amid growing yuan risks

articles.author: Clare Baldwin, Katherine Masters
articles.description: Walmart and Centric Brands are investigating their supply chains in Cambodia over allegations that inmates at the country's largest women's prison were illegally employed to produce garments for export, following questions posed by Reuters and inquiries from a U.S. industry group about labour practices there.
articles.title: Exclusive: Walmart, Centric probe suppliers for potential links to Cambodia women's prison

articles.author: Hannah Lang
articles.description: PayPal's (PYPL.O) stablecoin is likely to succeed where Facebook's failed, thanks to the payment giant's standing in Washington and policymakers' greater understanding of the issues in the last three years.
articles.title: Analysis: Why PayPal's stablecoin is likely to succeed where Facebook's Libra failed

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: After puzzling for years over the sluggish U.S. rebound from the 2007-2009 recession, the Federal Reserve had a reckoning at its policy meeting in September of 2016.
articles.title: Fed's long-term GDP outlook is dismal; the economy hasn't got the message yet

articles.author: Anton Bridge
articles.description: When SoftBank Group-owned (9984.T) chip designer Arm files for a Nasdaq IPO on Monday, investors are set to hone in on a key question - will the company have "exponential growth" due to the boom in artificial intelligence as CEO Masayoshi Son claims?
articles.title: Arm IPO to put SoftBank's AI hard sell to the test

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cracks are forming in a global stocks rally, with surging bond yields, rising energy prices and intensified worries over China’s economy among the factors sapping investors’ risk appetite following months of gains in equity markets.
articles.title: Summer of angst as bond yields surge and global stocks wobble

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The first tropical storm to hit Los Angeles in more than 80 years unleashed floods across parts of Southern California more accustomed to drought, as officials urged the public to stay safe as they began to count the cost of damage.
articles.title: Tropical Storm Hilary releases fury on Southern  California

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Monday a decision by Denmark and the Netherlands to donate the first F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine would only escalate the conflict, while Ukraine said the jets would help end Moscow's invasion.
articles.title: Russia says F-16s will escalate Ukraine war; Kyiv says they will tip the balance in its favour

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Spanish soccer federation president has been criticised by government ministers for kissing player Jenni Hermoso on the lips during the celebrations of their women's World Cup victory.
articles.title: Kiss for World Cup winner Jenni Hermoso criticised by Spanish ministers
